work.name: ENGIE
work.summary: ACE is a back-office system for the Ellipse application, a platform for onboarding and tracking Engie clients in decarbonization. As part of a team at ENGIE DIGITAL, the mission was to develop this project from scratch.
highlights: Designing the project architecture based on clean architecture principles.
Developing interfaces according to the ENGIE group's Design System.
Continuous development using Test-Driven Development (TDD).
Applying clean code principles.
Structuring the project using clean architecture.
Developing third-party libraries used by the API services.
Implementing authentication and user connection between ENGIE IMPACT users and the ACE back-office through OKTA.
Developing API services dedicated to the entire ENGIE DIGITAL group.
Delivering to the ENGIE IMPACT branch for the start of client onboarding in January 2024

work.name: AAREON
work.summary: This project was about the development of an interactive touch kiosk that will allow tenants of large social housing providers to connect at agency offices in order to perform various operations.
highlights: Development of interfaces according to the client's (landlord's) Design System.
Development of login functionality via an NFC reader.

Development of the following features: uploading an attachment via a QR Code, payment via a POS terminal or contactless, adding an attachment via a scanner, printing documents on an integrated thermal ink printer.
Enhancement of UI components.
Development of cross-platform components.
Participation in the writing of User Stories.
Participation in refining and prioritizing User Stories based on business value.
Development of features for presentations at the annual social housing congress.
Responsive adaptation following the arrival of a new kiosk in the 1024 x 768 format.

work.name: ITNOVEM (SNCF)
work.summary: Within the eIoT project, the team develops and maintains all the web applications and components used to read and process information from sensors across the entire Internet of Things (IoT) network in the Ile de France region for SNCF.
highlights: Study and improvement of the front-end tool RESTool developed in React.
Development of processing chain applications specific to each project.
Development and maintenance of API servers using NestJS.
Establishing connections between API applications, processing chains, and Azure Cloud using Service Bus and Event Hub.
Discussions and improvements of the user interfaces of processing chain applications.
Implementation of a common eslint package with team-specific rules.
Participation in the elaboration of user stories through refinement sessions (2-week sprints).
Functional testing and bug fixes.
Sprint planning participation, reviews, and retrospectives.

work.name: ColiveMe (BNP Paribas Real Estate)
work.summary: As member of the Coliveme project, a young startup at Bivwack, the team is developing a colocation marketplace in France with an innovative concept: coliving.
highlights: Study and development of the web interface in ReactJS.
Implementing the provided mockups by the UI/UX designer.
Discussing and improving interfaces based on customer feedback.
Utilizing tracking tools from Google and Facebook.
Refactoring React code to use Hooks.
Connecting to the backend in JAVA.
Participating in the elaboration and delivery of user stories (minimum 2-week sprints).
Conducting functional tests and addressing bugs.
Participation in sprint planning, review, and retrospective meetings.

highlights: Study and development of the web interface using ReactJS (Typescript).
Implementing the mockups provided by the UI/UX designer.
Connecting to a JAVA server via a NodeJS gateway.
Adapting data according to the specific client needs.
Participating in the elaboration and delivery of user stories (minimum 2-week sprints).
Conducting functional tests.
Participation in sprint planning, review, and retrospective meetings.
